Heading: Number of siblings
Value: 1 older half-brother who lived in another state, 1 younger sister

Heading: Birth category
Value: Middle of father, oldest child of mother

Heading: Teased while in school?
Value: Yes, because of stutter, fancy clothes, and taking ballet and violin lessons

Heading: Physically attractive?
Value: No, balding, crooked and yellow teeth, white and hairless hands

Heading: Physically abused?
Value: Yes, beaten by mother, went to school with bruises on legs, black eyes, visible welts

Heading: Psychologically abused?
Value: Yes, by both mother and father, told he was worthless.

Heading: Age of first sexual experience
Value: Pulled down girl’s underpants at age 8.

Heading: Father abused drugs/alcohol
Value: Yes, described as a heavy drinker.

Heading: Highest grade in school
Value: 10th, but complete GED at McNeil Island.

Heading: Applied for job as a cop?
Types of jobs worked
Value: Key chain distributor, Econo Print Shop

Heading: Employment status during series
Value: Employed at key chain distributor and print shop

Heading: Lives with his children
Value: No, children’s mother did not allow visitation. He saw his children sporadically as adults.

Heading: Bed wetting
Value: Yes, only confirmed by one source.

Heading: Been to a psychologist?
Value: Yes, during both incarcerations was examined by psychologist (prior to serial killings).

Heading: Time in forensic hospital?
Value: Yes, at age 14, Napa State Hospital

Heading: Committed previous crimes?
Value: Assault and Battery with a hammer on a woman in 1961, two counts of kidnapping and robbery in 1970.

Heading: Spend time in jail?
Value: Yes. Escaped with four other inmates after being sentenced for kidnapping and robbery, but before being sent to prison.

Heading: Victim type
Value: Hikers and joggers in woodlands around San Francisco and Santa Cruz.

Heading: Killer age at start of series
Gender of victims
Value: Women and the men they happened to be with.

Heading: Method of killing
Value: Execution style gun shots to the head or repeated stabbing.

Heading: How close did killer live?
Value: Drove to crime, but didn’t live too far away.

Heading: Killing occurred in home of victim?
Killing occurred in home of killer?
Weapon
Value: Killer brought with him a gun and a knife.

Heading: Rape?
Value: Raped four victims and attempted to rape another, but didn’t and killed her.

Heading: Overkill?
Value: Yes, in the one case where he stabbed the victim repeatedly in the chest.

Heading: Posed the body?
Value: Yes, one victim, Anne Alderson, was found lying against a tree.

Heading: Left at scene, no attempt to hide
Value: Yes. Six victims were simply left where they fell dead.

Heading: Moved, buried
Value: Yes. Four victims were found in shallow graves not far from where he killed them.

Heading: Sentence
Value: Death by the gas chamber at San Quentin.
